meanings.definition: The state or quality of having limits or boundaries.
meanings.sent1: The finitudes of the ocean are seen where the waves meet the shore.
meanings.sent2: She understood the concept of finitudes when she reached the end of the road.
meanings.sent3: The finitudes of the playground were tested when the children played tag.
meanings.sent4: His patience had finitudes, like a river that eventually dries up.
meanings.sent5: The finitudes of time became clear as the clock struck midnight.

meanings.definition: The condition of being finite or having a limited existence.
meanings.sent1: The finitudes of the cookie jar were evident when it was empty.
meanings.sent2: The finitudes of life became apparent as he grew older.
meanings.sent3: The finitudes of the candy supply were a concern for the trick-or-treaters.
meanings.sent4: Her energy had finitudes, like a battery that needed recharging.
meanings.sent5: The finitudes of the universe were explored by scientists.
